Uses of Package
org.protune.api

Packages that use org.protune.api
org.protune.api Under the architectural point of view, one of the main features of the Protune system is its mix between imperative and declarative components. 
org.protune.core Package org.protune.core provides the core classes of the Protune system. 
 

Classes in org.protune.api used by org.protune.api
Action
          Class Action is the superclass of each state predicate.
ActionWellPerformed
          A notification that an attempt to carry out an Action was performed in the right way.
ActionWrongPerformed
          A notification that an attempt to carry out an Action was performed in the wrong way.
Check
          A check whether an Action was really performed.
FilteredPolicy
          Represents a filtered policy.
LogAction
          Class LogAction represents the provisional predicate logged(X, logfile_name) which holds if X is recorded into logfile_name (cf. deliverable I2-D2).
Mapper
          The interface Mapper provides conversion utilities between the Java (resp.
Notification
          A notification that an attempt to carry out an Action was performed.
NotificationReliable
          A confirmation that what is asserted in a Notification is reliable.
NotificationUnreliable
          A confirmation that what is asserted in a Notification is not reliable.
Policy
          Represents a policy.
ReadAction
          Class ReadAction represents a state (not provisional) predicate.
SideEffectAction
          Class SideEffectAction represents a provisional predicate.
TimeReadAction
          Class TimeReadAction represents the state (not provisional) predicate time(T) which holds if T is the current time of the system (cf. deliverable I2-D2).
